description: Wire coderef folders from all projects into dashboard for browsing and exploration. Users can register/unregister projects and explore all coderef contents through unified API endpoints.
context: User requested a multi-project coderef folder explorer accessible via /coderef-assistant route on html-tools. Instead of building complex MCP wrapper layers, implement a lightweight file explorer: simple HTTP endpoints that serve coderef file contents from registered projects, backend reads filesystem directly, frontend renders content based on file type (markdown to HTML, JSON pretty-print, etc.). Key requirement: users can add/remove projects dynamically and immediately access them through the explorer without configuration changes.

technical_approach.backend: coderef-dashboard Python MCP server implements 7 endpoints
endpoints: GET /api/coderef/tree - full tree of all coderefs
technical_approach.data_structure: projects-registry.json stores registered projects with paths and metadata
technical_approach.frontend: html-tools /coderef-assistant route calls endpoints and renders content

deliverables: Path validation and security checks (prevent traversal attacks)
Multi-format content rendering support (JSON, markdown, text, yaml, csv, binary)

related_stubs.STUB-057: WO-Tracking (Dashboard Widget) - UI for displaying workorder/stub tracking
related_stubs.STUB-060: Dashboard API endpoints - Parent feature for all dashboard APIs

implementation_notes.integration_point: Extends existing coderef-dashboard with new endpoints for file exploration
implementation_notes.effort_estimate: Medium (4-6 hours) - endpoint spec is complete, implementation is straightforward file I/O + JSON responses
